meanings.definition: A traditional and widely accepted way of behaving or doing something.
meanings.sent1: In our family, it is a custom to have a big dinner on Thanksgiving.
meanings.sent2: Wearing a white dress is a custom for brides in many cultures.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite amusing if everyone suddenly decided to follow a new custom of wearing pajamas to work.
meanings.sent4: The custom of shaking hands to greet someone is like a silent agreement of respect.
meanings.sent5: The custom of blowing out candles on a birthday cake makes the celebration special.

meanings.definition: A practice or tradition that is specific to a particular group or place.
meanings.sent1: The custom of exchanging gifts on New Year's Eve is common in many countries.
meanings.sent2: The custom of bowing as a sign of respect varies across different cultures.
meanings.sent3: It would be amusing if a new custom of wearing sunglasses at night became popular.
meanings.sent4: The custom of hanging stockings by the fireplace is like a magical ritual for children.
meanings.sent5: The custom of painting eggs during Easter symbolizes new beginnings.
